questions.question: Filter to only show good diet quality records, then compare, do people with higher coffee consumption tend to sleep more or fewer hours?

answer.value: In most cases it's more, but the exception is that the sleep time is less when the number of coffee cups is 3 than when the number of coffee cups is 2.

key_insights: The view only has the good diet quality category left.
The number of coffee cups ranges from 0 to 5.
As shown in the figure, the sleep duration is longest when the number of coffee cups is 5.
In most cases people with higher coffee consumption tend to sleep more.
The exception is that the sleep time is less when the number of coffee cups is 3 than when the number of coffee cups is 2.

reasoning.reasoning: Use the filter categories tool to make the view show only good diet quality that meets the requirements of the problem.
To study the effect of coffee cups on sleep hours, the change encoding tool was used to make the view reflect the impact of coffee cups.
Switching the mode to grouped clearly shows the differences between different quantities of coffee cups.
